column1: A seizure is a sudden brief change in the electrical activity in the brain.
Your child may have brief periods of unconsciousness and uncontrollable body movements during seizures.
- Will my child need to take medicines during the school day?
- Can my child take antibiotics or other medicines also?
How about acetaminophen (Tylenol), vitamins, or herbal remedies?
Will I always be able to tell my child is having a seizure?
What should I do when my child is having a seizure?
